message.content:
Let $x$ be the number of times the ball bounces.  After $x$ bounces, the ball rises to $243\cdot \left(\frac{2}{3}\right)^x$ cm.  Setting $243\cdot (\frac{2}{3})^x<30$ and multiplying by $\frac{3^x}{30},$ we get $3^{x-1}<\frac{81}{10}.$  Since $3^2=9<\frac{81}{10}<\frac{27}{3} = 3^3,$ we know $x-1=\boxed{2}$ and $x=\boxed{3}.$

Note: When the height becomes less than $30$ cm, that is the fourth time the ball is on its way up.
